skillTree.localised_description: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Oda claimed this mighty beast from a defeated Chaos Lord.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
With a mighty cry Oda organizes her Huskarls and Shield-Maidens in line, forming an impenetrable wall of shields and meat.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.

skillTree.localised_description: Norscans flock to Horvenghaast to trade and partake in the famed "Duelling Circles," rooftop fighting rituals sacred to Khorne.
Oda Winterclaw has sailed every corner of the Bjornling coast, serving as it's guardian and champion.
Steel imported from Pack Ice Bay is used to forge the finest shields for the King's frontlines.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 5% for Infantry units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The deep bellows of Oda's Horn break winds and clouds as they invigor friendly troops.
Not many are trusted with dealing with the High King's affairs, yet as his trusted advisor Oda deals with trivial mundane management such as keeping the savage marauders in check.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: The elite of Skjold are the Huskarls and Shield Maidens that follow Oda in to battle, often trained on the towering island of Horvenghaast.

effects.description:
Global recruitment duration: -1 turns for Marauder Champions
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many are the dark horrors of twisted flesh and nightmares made real that the Ruinous Powers have visited upon the world, but few are quite as vicious.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Don't go anywhere near its mouth - in fact, don't even get within snapping distance if you value your limbs.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Blink and you die.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 20%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

items.colour_text: A vessel of legend, Drakkenguard was built from the ribs of a leviathan felled by Bjornling warriors and bound with iron said to be blessed by the gods. It does not sailâ€”it hunts, prowling the seas like a beast of the deep, shielding its crew with the wrath of the storm itself. It was gifted to Oda Winterclaw by the High King Ulfric Grondal after Winterclaw's clan backed the High King during the Bjornling expedition to the Southlands.

Forged in secret during the Long Cold by the shieldmaidens of Skjold, Skjoldrheim is more than a shield â€” it is a symbol of lineage, sacrifice, and survival. Crafted from lack alderwood soaked in glacier-water, reinforced with riveted storm-steel, and bound with braided horsehair, its surface bears no heraldry. Instead, it is carved with deep runes of defiance and ancestral oathmarks â€” each notch a battle stood, not fled. Passed down through the matriarchal lines of shieldmaidens, the shield was said to have once held fast against a three-day siege at the Howling Steps

Forged in the howling winds atop the Cliffs of Skjold, this spear bears ancient runes that bind it to the northern gales and the will of the Valkyries. When hurled by Oda Winterclaw, Hrafnsvartr becomes a streak of silver fury, its oath-bound course unbroken by shield, spell, or stone. It is said the spear listens only to Odaâ€™s hand and the winds that guide it, returning to her grip when her enemies lie pierced and broken. To see it thrown is to glimpse the wrath of the storm made manifest.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The legendary Shieldmaiden of Skjold is as much the King's asset as her popularity is his threat.

effects.description:
''Keep the Shields up!'' stance for Marauder Champion units
	(Hero's army)
